primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God rescues humanity from the sovereign powers of Sin and Death through the death and resurrection of Christ, incorporating the believer into this victory via baptism.

tekstueel_bewijs: In baptism the Holy Spirit acts to unite the person to Christ
Our union with him is something that God has done
God bridged that gap in his own person
all the benefits of his death become ours
we too might walk in newness of life
Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father
leads to acquittal and life for all human beings
the gospel comes to you with all its original power

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Apostle Paul (as witness)
tekstueel_bewijs: united with him in a death like his
All the preacher can do is to bear witness
the iron grip of Sin and Death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin and Death are described as sovereign rulers and ontological traps, not merely moral failings.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's ethical response to their new identity.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Baptized Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'doing' is strictly a consequence of the ontological 'being' established by God.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God bridged that gap in his own person.
The Holy Spirit acts to unite the person to Christ.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We slip back into Sin so frequently.
We could do nothing for ourselves.

voorbeelden: So you also must consider yourselves dead to sin.
would you want to go back to it?
Do you not know that all of us...
We have a new power over Sin now.
Now you can actually be an instrument of God’s righteousness!

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of power (Pouvoir) by God because the human subject is inherently incompetent (lack of Pouvoir) under the dominion of Sin.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Dominion) to ~S2 (Baptized Sinner) to S1 (Union with Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'prior action' which moves the subject from the axis of Death to the axis of Life.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Sin and Death are treated as inescapable tyrants.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humanity as the passive recipient of a cosmic rescue operation.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of Active Verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God bridged that gap in his own person.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Tennessee Williams is used not as a model to follow, but as a 'bruised reed' who is a recipient of grace despite failure.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and liberation from the burden of self-rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God is the one making us righteous).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The secondary program (ethics) is perfectly subordinated to the primary program (soteriology).
spanning_punten: The paradox of 'simul iustus et peccator'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Death no longer has dominion over him... Sin will have no dominion over you.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; an 'iron grip' that humans cannot break.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented homiletics. The actantial engine is driven by God's agency against cosmic opponents.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue emphasizing the 'cannot' of the human condition to highlight the 'can' of God.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' and 'moralism' by keeping the active verbs firmly in God's hands.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would look at the use of the Tennessee Williams anecdote for pathos, Greimassian analysis reveals that Williams functions as the 'Receiver' actant, proving the universality of the 'Subject's' (God's) action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what Paul meant; this analysis shows how the sermon's structure actually performs the gospel Paul preached.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that even when the preacher says 'You must,' it is framed within a 'Pouvoir' (ability) granted by the Subject, preventing it from becoming Law.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Axis of Desire' (Tennessee Williams' streetcar) to illustrate the human predicament, then replaces it with the 'Axis of Transmission' (God's gift in baptism).
